data.title: Impact Map Listings
data.meta_description: The Advanced Coronary Treatment (ACT) Foundation is the national charitable organization dedicated to establishing CPR and defibrillator training programs free for students in high schools across Canada.  The ACT Foundation's mission is to promote health and to empower Canadians to save lives.
data.text:
Province:

Alberta

825,000+ Alberta youth have been trained in CPR to date.

315 high schools have established the program.

45,000 students are trained by their teachers each year.

More than 1,100 teachers have been trained as CPR Instructors for their students.

ACT is now enhancing the CPR Program with AED training.

The ACT Foundation has enhanced the CPR Program with AED training.

Province:

Quebec

982,000 Quebec youth have been trained in CPR to date.

400 secondary schools have established the program.

68,000 students are trained by their teachers each year.

More than 3,600 teachers have been trained as CPR Instructors for their students.

The ACT Foundation has enhanced the CPR Program with AED training.

Province:

Saskatchewan

43,500 Saskatchewan youth have been trained in CPR to date.

13 schools have established the program.

More than 2,800 students are trained by their teachers each year.

Territory:

Yukon

The ACT Foundation established the High School CPR and AED Program in Yukon in 2016.

1,000 Yukon youth have been trained in CPR to date.
